thread.title: Re: She persisted: GOP state senator forcibly removed while criticizing the late Tom Hayden over Vietnam
thread.title_full: Re: She persisted: GOP state senator forcibly removed while criticizing the late Tom Hayden over Vietnam

author: Perso Nasplit
title: Re: She persisted: GOP state senator forcibly removed while criticizing the late Tom Hayden over Vietnam
text:
She persisted: GOP state senator forcibly removed while criticizing the late Tom Hayden over Vietnam Posted at 8:23   William A. 
This happened Thursday in the California Senate: @SenJanetNguyen 1st amnd silenced as she was removed from Sen chamber while speaking #caleg #shepersisted pic.twitter.com/EJBAqK96Fw 
— CA Senate GOP Caucus (@SenateRepCaucus) February 23, 2017 
The California Senate Republican Caucus drew the obvious connection to Sen. Elizabeth Warren by adding the hashtag #ShePersisted to its tweet. According to the Sacramento Bee , Sen. Nguyen, a Vietnamese refugee, had begun to criticize the late Democrat lawmaker Tom Hayden just two days after he had been memorialized. 
Hayden, an anti-war activist who traveled with then-wife Jane Fonda to North Vietnam in 1974, drew criticism from Nguyen, who said Hayden “sided with the communist government that enslaved and killed millions of Vietnamese, including my family.” Extremely grateful for the support for my #1stAmendment right to speak for the memory of those who fled persecution after the Vietnam War. 
— Senator Janet Nguyen (@SenJanetNguyen)   
From Assembly Member Melissa Melendez: CA senate dems honored Tom Hayden Tuesday, who said "a long-term goal of mine: the peaceful, nonviolent disappearance of the white race" MM 
— Melissa Melendez (@asmMelendez) February 24, 2017 California Sen. Janet Nguyen removed from Senate floor after speaking against Tom Hayden https://t.co/Lbic7cUsdh 
— Christopher Cadelago (@CapitolAlert) February 23, 2017 . @SenJanetNguyen , Vietnamese immigrant, removed from Senate floor after refusing to stop criticizing Tom Hayden, fmr Sen & anti-war activist 
— Jonathan J. Cooper (@jjcooper) February 23, 2017 CA Senate floor Thurs morning: Abbreviated video of roughly 4 minute incident where @SenJanetNguyen was removed for comments on Tom Hayden. pic.twitter.com/QHGHVpHHpe 
— John Myers (@johnmyers) February 23, 2017 Senate leader @kdeleon issues statement on this morning's removal of @SenJanetNguyen from Senate chamber. pic.twitter.com/mYKwNacY64 
— John Myers (@johnmyers) February 23, 2017 What happened after @SenJanetNguyen was removed from CA Senate after quarrel over rules regarding her Tom Hayden comments? Excerpts below.. pic.twitter.com/3Ggc8CPmXB 
— John Myers (@johnmyers) February 23, 2017 
College Republicans from California State University, Bakersfield finally found a use for the “I’m with her” tag. We stand with Senator Janet Nguyen! pic.twitter.com/zlkAhvTIxE
